summary: "Back in Black" is AC/DC's seventh album, released in 1980. It's their first with Brian Johnson, after the death of their previous singer, Bon Scott. The album was made in the Bahamas and is in memory of Scott, with its black cover serving as a "sign of mourning." "Back in Black" is one of the best-selling albums ever, with about 50 million copies sold. It made AC/DC super popular in the early 1980s and is often listed as one of the greatest albums of all time.
title: Back in Black
